ai.summary: Medieval Waverley (SCC) is a hard 25.1 km hike in the UK, offering a mix of forest trails, moorland, and rocky ascents.
ai.terrain_summary: The route includes uneven forest paths, exposed moorland, stone steps, and potential mud after rain. Expect several steep climbs and long stretches with limited shelter; footing can be uneven and weather conditions may change quickly.
ai.safety_notes: This is a long, hard hike in a potentially remote area. Plan the route in daylight, check current weather, and carry full navigation tools. Tell someone your planned route and expected return time. Bring plenty of water (at least 2 liters), high-energy food, and a fully charged phone or GPS device. Wear sturdy boots and layered, waterproof clothing. Be prepared for sudden weather changes, reduced visibility, and uneven ground. Watch for steep drops, unstable paths, and wildlife. If unsure about conditions, consider turning back.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Water and high-energy snacks (2–3 L water recommended)
Weather-appropriate layers and a waterproof jacket
Maps, compass, and/or a GPS device
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
Trekking poles (optional but helpful on rough terrain)

seo.title: Medieval Waverley (SCC) — 25.1 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the Medieval Waverley (SCC) hike in the UK: a challenging 25.1 km trek with varied terrain, safety tips, and a comprehensive gear guide.
